arm_group.arm_group_label: IMT Robotic Arm Therapy: Aim training
arm_group.description: Alternating sessions of planar (shoulder/elbow) and wrist robotic therapy programmed for aim training, 3x/week for 12 weeks.

arm_group.arm_group_label: IMT Robotic Arm Therapy: Smoothness Training
arm_group.description: Alternating sessions of planar (shoulder/elbow) and wrist robotic therapy programmed for smoothness training, 3x/week for 12 weeks.

arm_group.arm_group_label: IMT Robotic Arm Therapy: Impairment training
arm_group.description: Alternating sessions of planar (shoulder/elbow) and wrist robotic therapy programmed for whole-arm, impairment training, 3x/week for 12 weeks.

arm_group.arm_group_label: IMT Robotic Arm Therapy: Functional training
arm_group.description: Alternating sessions of planar (shoulder/elbow) and wrist robotic therapy programmed for whole arm, functional training, 3x/week for 12 weeks.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine if tailoring multiple sessions of upper extremity
      robotic therapy to focus on a particular aspect of movement (e.g smoothness vs. aiming;
      active range of motion vs. functional practice)can optimize therapeutic results and lead to
      greater functional returns in arm mobility after stroke.

clinical_study.brief_title: The General Use of Robots in Stroke Recovery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  18 years of age or older

          -  First single focal unilateral lesion with diagnosis verified by brain imaging, which
             occurred at least 6 months prior

          -  Cognitive function sufficient enough to understand experiments and follow
             instructions

          -  Fugl Meyer assessment at admission of 7 to 38 out of 66 (neither hemiplegic nor fully
             recovered motor function in the muscles of the shoulder, elbow, and wrist)

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Prior experience with robotic arm therapy

          -  Fixed contraction of the affected limb

          -  Complete flaccid paralysis of the affected limb

arm_group_label: IMT Robotic Arm Therapy: Aim training

intervention.description: Interactive Motion Technologies (IMT) planar and wrist robots for robotic arm therapy

clinical_study.official_title: Pilot Study of the Effects of Protocol-Specific Robotic Arm Therapy in Stroke Recovery

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Upper Extremity Fugl Meyer Motor Assessment
primary_outcome.time_frame: 12 weeks (immediately following the intervention) and 24 weeks (3 months after the intervention)

reference.citation: Stein J, Krebs HI, Frontera WR, Fasoli SE, Hughes R, Hogan N. Comparison of two techniques of robot-aided upper limb exercise training after stroke. Am J Phys Med Rehabil. 2004 Sep;83(9):720-8.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Kinematic Data recorded during therapy with IMT robots
secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Kinematic Data
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 weeks (immediately following the intervention) and 24 weeks (3 months after the intervention)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Fugl Meyer Sensation Scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 weeks (immediately following the intervention) and 24 weeks (3 months after the intervention)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Fugl Meyer Proprioception Scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 weeks (immediately following the intervention) and 24 weeks (3 months after the intervention)
